intro: Pelargonium triphyllum, commonly known as the three-leaf geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, Pelargonium triphyllum is widely grown as a garden plant.
